metadata.title: USN-6880-1 -- Tomcat vulnerability
metadata.description: Sam Shahsavar discovered that Apache Tomcat (8.5.0 to 8.5.82,  9.0.0-M1 to 9.0.67, 10.0.0-M1 to 10.0.26 or 10.1.0-M1 to 10.1.0) was  configured to ignore invalid HTTP headers via setting rejectIllegalHeader  to false (the default for 8.5.x only), Tomcat did not reject a request  containing an invalid Content-Length header making a request smuggling  attack possible if Tomcat was located behind a reverse proxy that also  failed to reject the request with the invalid header.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6880-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libtomcat8-embed-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 libtomcat8-java - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8 - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-admin - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-common - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-docs - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-examples - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 tomcat8-user - 8.5.39-1ubuntu1~18.04.3+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro  libtomcat9-embed-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 libtomcat9-java - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9 - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-admin - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-common - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-docs - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-examples - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 tomcat9-user - 9.0.16-3ubuntu0.18.04.2+esm1 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
